## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (-14.5, -48.5)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-15.0, -50.0)
- Wooden Chest at position (-14.5, -48.5)
- Stone Furnace at position (-13.0, -48.0)
- Burner Inserter at position (-14.5, -46.5)
- Iron Chest at position (-14.5, -47.5)
- Burner Inserter at position (-14.5, -45.5)

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (41.5, -80.5)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (41.0, -82.0)
- Iron Chest at position (41.5, -80.5)
- Stone Furnace at position (43.0, -82.0)
- Burner Inserter at position (43.5, -80.5)

### Additional Stone Furnaces
- Stone Furnace at position (-11.0, -48.0)
- Stone Furnace at position (-9.0, -48.0)

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when using inserters
- Ensure that inserters have source items available to pick up. If inserters are waiting for source items, check the supply chain to ensure raw materials are being delivered to the inserter's pickup position.

### Errors when inserting items
- Ensure that the inventory contains the items you are attempting to insert. For example, attempting to insert iron ore into a furnace without having iron ore in your inventory will result in an error. Always verify your inventory before attempting such actions.

### Errors due to lack of fuel
- Ensure that all fuel-dependent entities like burner mining drills and furnaces have sufficient fuel to operate. Regularly check and replenish fuel to avoid production halts.

### Errors due to full chests
- Regularly check the inventory of chests connected to production facilities. If a chest is full, it will halt the production process. Ensure that items are being removed from chests to maintain production flow.
